result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex Emmanuel Mayfield Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alex Emmanuel Mayfield Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Stephen Michael Govin appeared by video for Alex Emmanuel Mayfield Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
Review hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Early Intervention program Domestic Violence Deferred Prosecution Agreement, filed.

Defendant Alex Emmanuel Mayfield in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Status Conference. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel advises that they are now in a resolution posture, and further requests a deferred prosecution agreement hearing date. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Branch 10. This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Alex Emmanuel Mayfield in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense needs discovery and an offer.  Parties are requesting a status conference. Case is adjourned to 8-16-22 at 1:30 pm for a status conference.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff's Department 05/24/2022
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff's Department 05/24/2022

Cash bail bond previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.R.E. Third party contact is permitted for purposes of child transfer.

Defendant Alex Emmanuel Mayfield in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 10.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
